p: Nextstrain is powered by a collection of open-source bioinformatic tools to curate, analyze, and visualize available virus genomes [ 30]. These datasets are used to reconstruct the geographic structure and estimated virus spread using incorporated phylogenetic tools [ 14, 15]. To reduce runtimes, Nextstrain leverages TreeTime for the maximum likelihood phylogenetic analysis [ 35], through which the entire WNV dataset currently presented on Nextstrain ( n = 2,267 genomes as of June 2019) can be analyzed in under an hour on a modern computer.
